Navigating Tough Ethical Decisions in Public Service Organizations          Share this page                Facebook      Twitter      LinkedIn      Tumblr      Wordpress      Email                                                           Topics in Public Service - Fall 2014     Calendars   Events at Wagner   Graduation   Events Archive   Photo Gallery   NYU Wagner in the Media   News Archive   Faculty Experts for Media   Public Service Today Blogs   Public Service Today Podcasts   Space Rentals                  Request More Information    Apply to Wagner                                            Topics in Public Service - Fall 2014 - What Should I Do? Navigating Tough Ethical Decisions in Public Service Organizations         Presented by Dean Sherry Glied and Vice Dean Anthony Bertelli, this inaugural series of one-hour talks by NYU Wagner faculty will focus on diverse topics and innovative research. The new series will expose students to the latest thinking on subjects not covered during coursework, and will provide an opportunity for faculty and staff to hear unique perspectives on relevant and timely topics in public service.        Please select the session(s) for which you would like to RSVP.     Please RSVP for at least one event.           Monday, Sep. 22, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am Offloading: Divesting in Government Institutions Offloading: Divesting in Government Institutions Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Wednesday, Oct. 8, 2014, 6:00pm-7:00pm Little White Lies: Race and Social Policy in the United States Little White Lies: Race and Social Policy in the United States Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Monday, Oct. 27, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am How Do We Know What Works?: Research Methods in Public Service How Do We Know What Works?: Research Methods in Public Service Location: The Puck Building, Rice Conference Room / Newman Reception Area  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Wednesday, Nov. 12, 2014, 6:00pm-7:00pm Behavioral Economics: What Is It and What Role Could It Play in Public Policy? Behavioral Economics: What Is It and What Role Could It Play in Public Policy? Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Monday, Nov. 24, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am What Should I Do? Navigating Tough Ethical Decisions in Public Service Organizations          Share this page                Facebook      Twitter      LinkedIn      Tumblr      Wordpress      Email                                                           Topics in Public Service - Fall 2014     Calendars   Events at Wagner   Graduation   Events Archive   Photo Gallery   NYU Wagner in the Media   News Archive   Faculty Experts for Media   Public Service Today Blogs   Public Service Today Podcasts   Space Rentals                  Request More Information    Apply to Wagner                                            Topics in Public Service - Fall 2014 - What Should I Do? Navigating Tough Ethical Decisions in Public Service Organizations         Presented by Dean Sherry Glied and Vice Dean Anthony Bertelli, this inaugural series of one-hour talks by NYU Wagner faculty will focus on diverse topics and innovative research. The new series will expose students to the latest thinking on subjects not covered during coursework, and will provide an opportunity for faculty and staff to hear unique perspectives on relevant and timely topics in public service.        Please select the session(s) for which you would like to RSVP.     Please RSVP for at least one event.           Monday, Sep. 22, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am Offloading: Divesting in Government Institutions Offloading: Divesting in Government Institutions Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Wednesday, Oct. 8, 2014, 6:00pm-7:00pm Little White Lies: Race and Social Policy in the United States Little White Lies: Race and Social Policy in the United States Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Monday, Oct. 27, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am How Do We Know What Works?: Research Methods in Public Service How Do We Know What Works?: Research Methods in Public Service Location: The Puck Building, Rice Conference Room / Newman Reception Area  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Wednesday, Nov. 12, 2014, 6:00pm-7:00pm Behavioral Economics: What Is It and What Role Could It Play in Public Policy? Behavioral Economics: What Is It and What Role Could It Play in Public Policy? Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Monday, Nov. 24, 2014, 10:00am-11:00am What Should I Do? 28, 2014                                   Professor Jan Blustein Discusses Research Methods in Public Service  On October 27, NYU Wagner students, staff and faculty gathered for a one-hour lecture by Jan Blustein, professor of health policy and medicine at NYU Wagner, as part of the Topics in Public Service lecture series. During her talk, Dr. Blustein reviewed different research methods that are used to evaluate the impact of health programs, such as the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program offered through the NY Department of Health.      The Topics in Public Service lecture series is presented by Dean Sherry Glied and Vice Dean Anthony Bertelli as a way for faculty members to share their research and perspectives on relevant and timely topics. Visit the events page to see the full Topics in Public Service schedule .                         What's new at NYU Wagner?
